titlePart.text: EQUIPMENT FOR FITTING IN OR TO AIRCRAFT
ARRANGEMENTS OR MOUNTING OF POWER PLANTS OR PROPULSION TRANSMISSIONS
Dropping, ejecting, releasing, or receiving articles, liquids, etc., in flight
titlePart.entryReference: with respect to sighting devices takes precedence

titlePart.text: the articles being explosive, e.g. bombs
Stowage arrangements for the devices in aircraft
Dropping or releasing powdered, liquid or gaseous matter
Aircraft adaptations to facilitate towing or being towed
titlePart.entryReference: ground installations for launching or towing aircraft

titlePart.text: Aircraft transported by aircraft, e.g. for release or reberthing during flight
titlePart.entryReference: flying units formed by separate aircraft

titlePart.text: Arrangements of military equipment, e.g. armaments, armament accessories, or military shielding, in aircraft
Adaptations of armament mountings for aircraft
titlePart.entryReference: armaments or mountings therefor per se

titlePart.text: of rocket launchers or releasing means
Equipment for facilitating passenger embarkation or the like
titlePart.entryReference: structures integral with fuselage to facilitate loading, fuselage floors specially adapted for freight, steps mounted on, and retractable within, aircraft

titlePart.text: Flight-deck installations not otherwise provided for
Arrangements or adaptations of air-treatment apparatus for aircraft crew or passenger, or freight space
titlePart.entryReference: respiratory apparatus or component parts thereof for high-altitude aircraft

titlePart.text: the air being heated or cooled
De-icing or preventing icing on exterior surfaces of aircraft
titlePart.entryReference: motor vehicles specially adapted for carrying de-icing equipment

titlePart.text: by ducted hot gas or liquid
controlled cyclically along length of surface
by mechanical means, e.g. pulsating mats or shoes attached to, or built into, surface
the surface being an aerofoil, rotor, or propeller
Means for detecting icing or initiating de-icing
formed with two or more canopies arranged about a common axis
formed with two or more canopies arranged in a cluster
Secondary or shock-absorbing canopies attached to load line
constructed to provide variable or non-uniform porosity over area of canopy
secured to hem of main canopy
adapted to control direction or rate of descent
incorporating friction devices or frangible connections to reduce shock loading of canopy
Releasable fastening devices between parachute and load or pack
with separate pack for extractor of auxiliary parachute
formed with separate compartments for main canopy, rigging lines, or auxiliary parachute
attached to hem of main canopy
attached to apex of main canopy
Sequential deployment of a plurality of canopies
facilitated by method of folding or packing
in association with other load-retarding apparatus
in association with aircraft, e.g. for braking thereof
Emergency apparatus or devices, not otherwise provided for
titlePart.entryReference: jettisoning of fuel tanks or fuel per se
severable or jettisonable parts of fuselage facilitating emergency escape

titlePart.text: Supports or holding means for living bodies
Arrangement or mounting of power plant in aircraft

titlePart.entryReference: attitude, flight- direction, or altitude control of aircraft by jet reaction

titlePart.text: Aircraft characterised by the type or position of power plant
titlePart.entryReference: fuselages or wings adapted for mounting power plant

titlePart.text: using steam, electricity, or spring force
Aircraft characterised by construction of power-plant mounting

titlePart.entryReference: wings adapted for mounting power plant

titlePart.text: Attaching of nacelles, fairings, or cowlings

titlePart.entryReference: conjoint control of power plant and propeller

titlePart.text: for preventing asymmetric thrust upon failure of one power plant
for equalising or synchronising power plants
Transmitting means between initiating means and power plants
Arrangement in aircraft of power plant parts or auxiliaries not otherwise provided for

titlePart.entryReference: air intakes for gas-turbine plants or jet-propulsion plants per se
air intakes for combustion engines in general

titlePart.text: of exhaust outlets or jet pipes
titlePart.entryReference: exhaust outlets for combustion engines in general
jet pipes or nozzles for jet-propulsion plants per se
plants characterised by the form or arrangement of the jet pipe or nozzle
cooling of internal-combustion engines per se
cooling of gas-turbine plants or jet-propulsion plants per se ,

titlePart.text: Transmitting power from power plant to propellers or rotors

titlePart.entryReference: propellers or rotors per se, helicopter transmissions

titlePart.text: characterised by the type of power plant
characterised by the transmission driving a plurality of propellers or rotors
the propellers or rotors being counter-rotating
characterised by the transmission being driven by a plurality of power plants
Arrangements in connection with fuel supply for power plant

titlePart.entryReference: tanks constructed integrally with aircraft wings

titlePart.text: Arrangement thereof in or on aircraft

titlePart.entryReference: transferring fuels to adjust aircraft trim

titlePart.text: facilitating emptying in any position of tank
Safety measures not otherwise provided for, e.g. preventing explosive conditions
titlePart.entryReference: extinguishing or preventing fires in aircraft

titlePart.text: Means for paying-in or out hose
for indicating aircraft speed or stalling conditions
Aircraft indicators or protectors not otherwise provided for
Safety measures to prevent collision with earth's surface
Arrangements or adaptations of signal or lighting devices
the lighting devices being primarily intended to illuminate the way ahead
